department.dept_long_name: Department of Organismic and Evolutionary Biology

course.title: Plants and Climate
course.description: How plants are affected by climate - both spatially across the globe and as climate changes over time - is relevant to understanding patterns of plant evolution, ecosystem structure, and the impact of humans on our planet. This course examines how variation in rainfall, temperature, atmospheric humidity and CO2 affects the growth and productivity of plants. Topics include photosynthesis, respiration, transpiration, and vascular transport; experimental approaches and measurement techniques will also be covered.
course.prerequisites: OEB 52, 55 or OEB 10 (or permission of the instructor).
